alert.note: Alert for McIntosh; Pittsburg (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 23 at 4:44PM CDT until September 23 at 11:00PM CDT by NWS Tulsa
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Oklahoma, including the following counties, McIntosh and Pittsburg. * WHEN...Until 700 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 444 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to a slow moving, lone thunderstorm. Radar indicates rainfall rates in excess of 2 inches per hour will be possible along the path of the storm. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Crowder... Canadian... Indianola... Raiford... Vivian... Arrowhead State Park... - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
